details.title: IDAS REST calls
details.description: Operator for executing REST calls to the IDAS server

preference.name: use_user_fiware_token
preference.label: Use the FIWARE credentials of the user
preference.description: Use the FIWARE credentials of the user logged into WireCloud. Take into account this option cannot be enabled if you want to use this widget in a public workspace as anonoymous users doesn't have a valid FIWARE auth token

preference.name: use_owner_credentials
preference.label: Use the FIWARE credentials of the workspace owner
preference.description: Use the FIWARE credentials of the owner of the workspace. This preference takes preference over "Use the FIWARE credentials of the user". This feature is available on WireCloud 0.7.0+ in a experimental basis, future versions of WireCloud can change the way to use it making this option not funcional and requiring you to upgrade this operator

preference.name: ngsi_tenant
preference.label: NGSI tenant/service
preference.description: Tenant/service to use when connecting to the server. Must be a string of alphanumeric characters (lowercase) and the "_" symbol. Maximum length is 50 characters. If empty, the default tenant will be used

preference.name: ngsi_service_path
preference.label: Service path
preference.description: Scope/path to use when connecting to the IoT agent. Must be a string of alphanumeric characters (lowercase) and the "_" symbol separated by "/" slashes. Maximum length is 50 characters. If empty, the default service path will be used: /

inputendpoint.name: getServices
inputendpoint.label: Fetch services
inputendpoint.description: Retrieve the list of available services

inputendpoint.name: addService
inputendpoint.label: Add service
inputendpoint.description: Add a new service, returns list of available services

inputendpoint.name: editService
inputendpoint.label: Edit service
inputendpoint.description: Edit an existing service, returns list of available services

inputendpoint.name: delService
inputendpoint.label: Delete service
inputendpoint.description: Delete an existing service, returns list of available services

inputendpoint.name: getDevices
inputendpoint.label: Fetch devices
inputendpoint.description: Retrieve the list of available devices. If the input data contains the subservice as well as device ID or entity ID and type attribute, only the corresponding devices are retrieved.

inputendpoint.name: addDevice
inputendpoint.label: Add device
inputendpoint.description: Add a new device, returns list of all devices of the same entity

inputendpoint.name: editDevice
inputendpoint.label: Edit device
inputendpoint.description: Edit an existing device, returns list of all devices of the same entity

inputendpoint.name: delDevice
inputendpoint.label: Delete device
inputendpoint.description: Delete an existing device, returns list of available devices
